newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE - Maryland Transportation Dept.
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - Maryland Transportation Dept.

text.p: SUMMARY BOND SALE NOTICE
Department of Transportation of Maryland
Consolidated Transportation Bonds, Series 1996
SEALED BIDS for the Bonds will be received by the Department of Transportation of Maryland (the

Department'') in the Finance Conference Room, Second Floor of the Harry R. Hughes Transportation Building, 10 Elm Road, Baltimore/Washington International Airport, Maryland until 11:00 a.m. (local Baltimore, Maryland time) on Wednesday,
November 20, 1996

at which time and place all proposals will be publicly opened and the successful bidder(s) announced. Bids must be submitted on forms provided by the Department. Bids may be submitted by facsimile transmission as provided in the full Notice of Sale.
The $50,000,000 Consolidated Transportation Bonds, Series 1996 (the Bonds''
) shal

est payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December. The Bonds shall be dated December 1, 1996 and shall bear interest at such rates per annum as specified by the successful bidder, whose bid in the determination of the Secretary of

Transportation, shall result in the lowest true interest cost in accordance with the terms set forth in the full Notice of Sale. The Bonds will mature serially in various amounts from December 1, 1998 through December 1, 2011. The Bonds are redeemable at the option of the Department in accordance with the terms set forth in the full Notice of Sale. No bid for less than all the Bonds or for less than 99% of the par value of the Bonds will be considered.
The issuance of the Bonds will be subject to the

unqualified approving legal opinion of J. Joseph Curran, Jr., Attorney General of Maryland, Edward R.K. Hargadon, Assistant Attorney General, Counsel to the Department, Piper & Marbury, L.L.P., Baltimore, Maryland and Alexander,
Bearden, Hairston & Marks, L.L.P., Silver Spring, Maryland, Bond Counsel.
Additional information concerning the Department, this issue and a description of the security therefor is

contained in the Preliminary Official Statement of the Department dated November 7, 1996, the Notice of Sale and Bid Form to which prospective bidders are directed. Copies of these documents may be obtained from Beverley K. Swaim- Staley, Director, Office of Finance, Department of
Transportation of Maryland, P.O. Box 8755,

Baltimore/Washington International Airport, Maryland 21240- 0755 (410) 865-1039 or the Department's Financial Advisors, Public Financial Management, Inc., NationsBank Plaza, Suite 3850, 600 Peachtree Street, N.E., Atlanta, Georgia, 30067, (404) 876-1919, and The Chapman Company, 401 East Pratt Street, Baltimore, Maryland 21202 (410) 625-9656.
Secretary of Transportation
(From The Bond Buyer)
